column4: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=468793 has some info on blacklisting, that might work, you'll need to find the module name for your intel card though...
, so far i have come , Now i need help to get it to work . Like i said , im new to linux ,

lspci -k -s 00:02.0 should give you the name(s) of the kernel modules/drivers in use for the intel card. Then you should be able to add a line "blacklist *" (where * is the name of the module(s)) to the file /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist ...
